intro: Axinaea dentata, commonly known as the toothed axinaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a serrated or toothed edge, giving it its common name. Axinaea dentata is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests.
